alert.note: Alert for Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Southeast Fayette (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 7:59PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms and heavy rain will impact portions of southwestern Nicholas and central Fayette Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 758 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near Babcock State Park, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Babcock State Park, Ansted, Gauley Bridge, Hawks Nest State Park, Kesslers Cross Lanes, Drennan and Swiss. This includes Route 19 between mile markers 16 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Southeast Fayette
